roleset.name: wreck clandestinely

example.name: just transitive
example.text: Guerrilla leaders said Pretoria-1 was attempting *trace*-1 to sabotage next week's elections in Namibia.

roleset.note: No Vncls. Beautiful etymology behind this. During the Industrial Revolution in France, disgruntled (and displaced) workers would toss their wooden shoes, called "sabot"s, into the machinery of the new factories, naturally causing the machinery to break. This kind of willful destruction came to be called sabot-age.

predicate.note: Frames file for 'sabotage' based on sentences in wsj.
